  freestar.config = freestar.config || {};

        <div class="grid-container" id="main-content">
                            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-x">
    <div class="small-12 medium-12 large-9 cell">

Top notes are Bergamot, Flowers and Coriander; middle notes are Apple, Ambroxan and Vanilla; base notes are Tonka Bean, Ambergris and Woodsy Notes. </p><p class="reviewstrigger" style="font-size:                             <div class="cell small-12" style="display: inline-flex; margin: 0.4rem;word-wrap: break-word;padding: 0 0.6rem 0 0.6rem;">
                    <div class="fa-lg" style="display: flex; align-items: center; color: grey; cursor: pointer;">

                    </div>
                    May trigger headaches or nausea in some people
                </div>
                            <div class="cell small-12" style="display: inline-flex; margin: 0.4rem;word-wrap: break-word;padding: 0 0.6rem 0 0.6rem;">

    <div class="strike-title"><span>All Reviews By Date</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
        <div class="cell destinationreview"></div>                    <div id="parent2361164" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2361164" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Fragriminator"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1632910"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1632910.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Fragriminator" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nishane/Hacivat-44174.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.44174.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hacivat"title="Hacivat"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2361164ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2361164" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1632910">Fragriminator</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-25">11/25/24 16:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got a 3ml decant of this a few weeks ago after testing it in the flagship Manhattan store near my office. Gives MYSLF le parfum vibes a strong 80% up top. Definitely a fabric softener hit on open. Settling down after five mins with a warm yet cool nuttiness. I feel that I shouldn't like this so much but it's just so damn chewy and addictive. Please tell me wtf I mean by that. There's a chewiness to this like there is to Dior Homme Intense. This has nothing to do with DHI other than the fact that it makes me want to chew a huge wad of watermelon Bubble Yum. I'm sorry about this fu3king nonsense. It's just how it hits. The drydown is SUPER sneaky. I detect no ambergris for at least the first half of its life, but then out of the woods comes this mild inoffensive vanilla ambergis. Mixing ice cream with whale sh1t sounds weird af but it for sure works here. I'm usually not a big fan of ambergris because most ambergris accords want you to know they're emulating a gob of whale a$s expulsion, but here it's just the right blend of as$y + classy, no cap as the children say. I really like this because it's designer with enough detours to make an interesting ride. Only thing that sucks about this (which is why i got the decant) is the dumba$$ price. Then i went in on a big bottle of game of spades wildcard for like $85 and it's almost exactly the same as my decant except for a slightly less cohesive opening but better staying power. Peace 2 u fragcreeps.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2361164"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2361164#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2356983" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2356983" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Justinroberts42"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2316007"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Justinroberts42" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2356983ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2356983" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2316007">Justinroberts42</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-21">11/21/24 18:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sensational Fragrance. Makes you smell like money literally. It has a fresh hit of citrus in the beginning and then you can see the apple and flowers come in and help it settle down down to this clean smelling vanilla with an ambery presence very masculine. Its tough to describe that its so clean in its own way. I would overspray it slightly to get compliments but the longevity is decent with it too. Overall This is so good you can wear it to a casual lunch to a nice dressed down dinner or even to go out and have fun. Its so versatile that its a great signature scent. Super elegant 10/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2356983"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2356983#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2354764" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2354764" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="YaGirlSniffsMe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1171227"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1171227.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="YaGirlSniffsMe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Kalan-56036.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56036.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Kalan"title="Kalan"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2354764ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2354764" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1171227">YaGirlSniffsMe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-19">11/19/24 18:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love love love love this stuff. Honestly took me forever but I realized this sent is in the same category as like a A&amp;F fierce style perfume but smells nothing like fierce. Honestly the freshest cologne Ive ever smelled like insanely fresh. This is a for sure head turner/lady magnet dang what you got on type of DNA. Masculine, fresh classy type of smell you can dress up or down. <br />
<br />
I dont know who dont like this only thing I dont like is the price but its in the running for my favorite fragrance of all time with how versatile this is and how much women love it. Also I personally love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2354764"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2354764#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2350061" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2328040" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jigginssean"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1034490"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1034490.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jigginssean" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Aventus-9828.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9828.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aventus"title="Aventus"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2328040ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2328040" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1034490">jigginssean</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-26">10/26/24 03:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Initial impressions after my first few wearings are that this is a versatile, semi fresh, semi powdery, decent performing frag. I have received no positive feedback on it so far unfortunately but I'd be surprised if it didn't get any! You get a nice scent bubble and it develops nicely from fresh/powdery to slightly sweeter/spicier late on.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2328040"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2328040#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2325612" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2325612" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Samir66"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/666509"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.666509.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Samir66" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/La-Nuit-de-L-Homme-Bleu-Electrique-67997.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67997.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Nuit de L'Homme Bleu lectrique"title="La Nuit de L'Homme Bleu lectrique"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2325612ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2325612" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74); <br />
Im not one to seek compliments, but this gem never fails to garner positive attention. Its so easy to wear, effortlessly elegant. <br />
<br />
10/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2325612"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2325612#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2318249" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2318249" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="raynbagun"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2289298"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="raynbagun" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2318249ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2318249" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2289298">raynbagun</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-16">10/16/24 21:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For me its an everyday scent nothing crazy and it gets the least amount of compliments out of my collection which makes sense for how well-rounded it is. The smell is mostly the bergamot, green apple, and ambroxan, then once that tones down the vanilla comes thru. this is really for any occasion so you don't have to worry about it being too fancy or basic for wherever you're going. the longevity and projection is not and issue but its not beastly I wore it to work for 6-7 hours and still smelt it on my wrists going to sleep at night. (But also keep in mind that I get trigger happy sometimes)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2318249"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2318249#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2313802" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Great for a date. Smells like candied dryer sheets. <br />

10/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2313802"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2313802#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2310829" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Nothing special considering the price point. It's still a good scent. Last on my a good 6 hours with the first 2 hours of good projection. Use it for 2 consecutive days for work and receive compliments on each day. Telling me that they like the smell of the perfume that i have on. Sweet vanilla flowers. Try it on a 2 ml decant.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2310829"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2310829#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2305785" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1882714">JJ2137</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-04">09/04/24 16:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If there was a contest to guess who was the perfumer behind this my bet would be on Michel Almairac cuz it's the same shit he recycles for different brands for 30 years<br />
<br />
Edit: I'm dying, he IS the perfumer</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2271793"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2271793#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2271476" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1426946">MattyMack514</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-30">08/30/24 10:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Just got my sample in and let me start off by saying this, its very good. I like it. However, its nothing i havnt smelled before. I find it hilarious when i instantly get reminded of specific scents and legit none of them are in the reminds me of. Niche wise, this smells like a mix of PDM Pegasus and Amouage Reflection man to me. It also reminds me of a better YSL Myslf, but not by much. Wont be a full bottle for me because it has the same purpose of others i already have but ill get good use out of my sample for sure.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1834547">bdgarver</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-29">08/29/24 17:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This scent is one of those that get better every time you wear it.  Smells like a more amber dense Allure Homme. Maybe a touch sweeter as well. Not nearly as dense as the notes indicate.  Its a cold weather profile made for warm weather.  Mass appeal for sure. Co workers and clients have complimented this scent all summer. That being said there is a really good almost better dupe out there that makes this irrelevant. I have worn both enough to say for sure I would never buy a whole bottle of LS over WC.  Im glad I bought a sample. Hope it saves you guys a buck or 2.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2265227"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2265227#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2256525" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2252429" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ismellthebest"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1305612"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1305612.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ismellthebest" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/XJ-1861-Naxos-30529.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30529.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="XJ 1861 Naxos"title="XJ 1861 Naxos"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2252429ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2252429" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1305612">Ismellthebest</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-17">08/17/24 12:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Buy Lafayette? Well Not Yet<br />
<br />
To me, Bond's Lafayette Street offers a sweet fresh &amp; fruity undertone as it opens up.  Good projection and it lasts. It's definitely a warm weather scent to wear.  <br />
<br />
Thats the good news. Here is the bad news - I paid retail for my bottle and found out later I could have saved a couple hundred dollars had a gone a different route.<br />
<br />
Jo Milano's Wild Card smells identical to Lafayette Street and its much, much cheaper. So, if you want the better BING- POW- BANG!!!! for your buck... I suggest that you not walk down Lafayette Street.... maybe walk down the Milano Street.  <br />
<br />
I wish I had known this before I purchased my initial bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2252429"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2252429#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2251740" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2021922">Berk Y.</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-05">08/05/24 17:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When you look at the notes, it seems like a nice winter perfume, but it's actually not. it is a 4-season perfume, but I think it suits spring more, it is not too suffocating in mild weather.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2240020"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2240020#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2239256" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2239256" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TheodoreMnts"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1876922"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1876922.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TheodoreMnts" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2239256ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2239256" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1876922">TheodoreMnts</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-05">08/05/24 01:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Currently my all-time favorite niche fragrance. The fresh sprays just feels itchy to the nose and occasionally makes me cough, but I still wear it anyways. Im amazed how its amber vanilla fresh during the initial sprays, and gets a tad bit sweeter in the dry down without being gourmand; just a hint of sweetness to add more flavor. <br />
<br />
I love the freshness of the citrus and florals overtime. Im not sure if the fragrance isnt as long-lasting, my skin chemistry, or nose blindedness. I just feel like it doesnt stay as long, but it cant replace my love and adoration for this fragrance. No wonder Omar (School of Scent) and Melissa (Melissa Nacional) have dedicated videos for this fragrance.<br />
<br />
Definitely in my for life, not to mention my most expensive and successful blind buy to date </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2239256"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2239256#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2238506" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2040712">advil</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-09">07/09/24 06:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>this stuff has amazing performance and smells so so good i get mainly vanilla and amber with a little citrusy fruity kinda vibe, kinda similar to swy intensely but a bit more suitable for warmer weather. its honestly way too expensive tho, id recommend it if it was like $150. cant justify paying 300-400 for this but it smells so so good<br />
<br />
okay update it smells soooo so good, the middle notes are heavy in the vanilla but once it dries down all the way it smells amazing, it has a good amount of citrusy notes and is heavy on ambroxan so if you like ambroxan youll love this. the most prominant smells in the opening to me is citrusy, then vanilla/ambroxan, then a mix of all of them. its superr good but test before you buy</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; Just an easy wear, any time any place. However, I dont know if its just my batch or what, but I get pretty horrible performance. 2 hours on my skin if Im lucky. This smells like a designer fragrance you could get off discounters for 40-50. I'm not dismissing the quality but this doesn't smell like a 300 fragrance.. bleecker street for instance is a much more interesting fragrance</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2190260"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2190260#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2189458" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2189458" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BaroqueBookwyrm"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1494447"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1494447.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="BaroqueBookwyrm" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Afnan/Supremacy-Not-Only-Intense-68271.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68271.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Supremacy Not Only Intense"title="Supremacy Not Only Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2189458ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2189458" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1494447">BaroqueBookwyrm</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-15">06/15/24 17:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance is bright and fun, juicy and playful.<br />
<br />
When I was a teen, and many times since, I have removed sugar from my diet. When doing so, I would often take opportunities to enjoy sweets through smell rather than through taste. One of the best smelling sweets, to me, is the inside of an empty skittles bag. This fragrance opens with that same empty skittles bag scent, but turned up to 11/10. For me, it's an island of joy, a moment of blissful olfactory reprieve from the gustatory desolation of a high protein diet. It reminds me of finding enjoyment through smell before I discovered the world of fragrances. My wife and daughter do not agree about the skittles bag. I'd ask for someone else to confirm, but I don't think anyone is weird enough to have huffed empty skittles bags like I did.<br />
<br />
It dries down into some musk with a powdery clean background, at this point it reminds me a bit of BR540. Lasts long and strong on clothing and the scent bubble starts big but becomes an intimate frag within about 1.5 hours. I got a free sample from a local cosmetics retailer. I can't fathom paying $300-$400 dollars for this though. Although seeing sculpture in the "reminds me of" section makes me want to get my hands on that one.<br />
<br />
Update: I went ahead and purchased Sculpture Homme Parfum as a blind buy based on its reported similarity to this frag. It has this same skittles bag sweetness but it lasts MUCH longer. I thought it was a top note only, but in Sculpture it is clearly a heart note, lasting 5 to 6 hours. Beautiful. If you want the candy sweetness of this frag in a more masculine fragrance, Sculpture Homme Parfum is perfect (and costs under $50).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2189458"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2189458#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2186652" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1287462">Jake Thee Snake</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-29">05/29/24 15:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This one smells similar to Kenneth Cole: Mankind Hero but with much more life to it. You know, that Bond No. 9 over the top style. I remember smelling it at a mall a year or so ago and when I got to the car, out of all the PDM, Creed &amp; Bond fragrances I saved test strips of all the scents &amp; Lafayette Street is what I kept going back to. It is SO nice. Bit of a thick fragrance. To me, it leans more for cooler weather than warm and definitely for nights.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2171762"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2171762#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2171678" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Smells very high quality, you smell like youre expensive but also very warming and super sensual. Its a work of art. Complex, yet I think everybody will complement you and love it! Also 10+ hours on skin and 12+ on clothing. Its definitely unisex.<br />
<br />
10/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2156223"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2156223#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2150883" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2150883" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="montee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1221166"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1221166.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="montee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Chinatown-1300.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1300.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chinatown"title="Chinatown"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2150883ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2150883" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1221166">montee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-09">05/09/24 14:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the first perfume I've gotten an unsolicited compliment from a total stranger, it was a lady on the bus. How nice....<br />
<br />
Fresh, clean, fruity opening - Then an ambery, vanilla, woodsy drydown... but still fresh! If you love ambery vanillas but are sad that it's mostly reserved for cooler weather, this works amazingly well in the summer. 8 hours of longevity and projects moderately for a long time, 4 hours! The price is so steep though!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2150883"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2150883#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2141590" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; PM me for info (only accepting cashapp or venmo) ONLY IN THE USA</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2139870"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2139870#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2138713" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2138713" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Boxing Wiz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1006387"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Boxing Wiz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51742.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lafayette Street"title="Lafayette Street"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2138713ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2138713" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1006387">Boxing Wiz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-27">04/27/24 23:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have never purchased or worn anything from Bond No.9. The bottles are all the same star shape, and the names somewhat odd which made it difficult for myself to remember what is what. Today I was going to mall with my wife because she wanted a new handbag. While she was looking, I slipped away to see what new fragrances had come out that I had yet gotten a chance to smell them. I forget from which store I bought this. We'd been through Nordstrom, Neiman Marcus, Bloomingdales and a few others. I enjoy all of the different brands having testers on display, as it gives me the opportunity to get an idea of the scents. Too often something might be jump out to me and I think the incredible, only to take it home and end up actually not enjoy them. Whenever at stores that carry the higher end designer and niche brands. So today looking to possibly get a new bottle for myself and possibly my wife.  There was a pretty large amount of various brands and scents  I  was on the fence trying to decide on something. I was narrowing down the choices, wanting to make a purchase and get out. The choices were between a couple from Xerjoff, some Bond No.9, one or two Initio, and Grand Soir. The salewoman was hand me a sample card about every 10 seconds it seemed. She asked me if I had tried Lafayette and I just said yes in an effort to slow her from handing me anymore.  I had just tried Nolita and was getting a bit tired as again I hear the lady "oh you'll love this." I just said give me the Nolita (for my wife)so I could get out of there. She asked if I was buying for myself also. I said I was going to, but I'd forgotten which one I wanted. She pointed to the Lafayette that she liked it a lot, and thought I had said I did. I said how I was leaning towards one of the Clive Christian. She said well just buy both that I liked. I'd already given them a couple thousand dollars on a YSL handbag for my wife. I wasn't wanting to give another $2000 today. So I said "just give me Lafayette."<br />
 When I got home I sprayed one spray of Lafayette on my arm. It was actually a bit different from anything else I have or have had. The opening is difficult for me to explain, but pleasant. It is definitely sweet, but not overly. It has wood scent mixed into it as well. I will say while it's not too strong, one could easily over spray. It is quite strong for scent it is. The dry down to brings more of the vanilla out. If the price is not going to hurt your bankroll, I think it is safe enough for a blind purchase. I think it is more for males, but it's not so masculine that ladies could not pull it off.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2138713"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2138713#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2127021" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2127021" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nachooo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1936483"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1936483.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nachooo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/The-Moon-56095.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56095.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Moon"title="The Moon"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2127021ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2127021" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1936483">Nachooo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-16">04/16/24 22:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is an easy crowd pleaser. I completely agree with the below review, it an upscaled version of eros or similar fragrances. I really cannot see someone blind buying this and being disappointed. I have a sample of this but do not see myself pouring out the dough Bond is asking. There are way too many similar fragrances on the cheap side that can do the job Lafayette does.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2127021"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2127021#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2126355" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2126355" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="s_lab95"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1318120"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1318120.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="s_lab95" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-51694.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51694.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Burberry Her"title="Burberry Her"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2126355ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2126355" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1318120">s_lab95</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-16">04/16/24 07:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First spray is fresh and spicy, then as it dries down it gets sweet. I personally havent smelled anything like it so it is very unique to me. I could see anyone rocking this scent. Versace Eros has vanilla, ambroxan &amp; apple but this is much more sophisticated and toned down.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2126355"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2126355#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2119672" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2119672" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JJ2137"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1882714"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="JJ2137" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2119672ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2119672" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1882714">JJ2137</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-09">04/09/24 16:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>@gharper <br />
It's not that this smells cheap - THIS is the clone of the cheap fragrances that exist on the market since 1995 and doesn't improve on the DNA on any substantial level. The high price may have been justified, if it had pioneered the scent DNA, otherwise this is just a cash grab. This fragrance is great... until you smell 15$ Jaguar Classic Gold and realize it's the same juice.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2119672"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2119672#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2108233" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2108233" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gharper"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1787902"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1787902.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gharper" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Armaf/Club-de-Nuit-Intense-Man-Limited-Edition-Parfum-77861.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.77861.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Club de Nuit Intense Man Limited Edition Parfum"title="Club de Nuit Intense Man Limited Edition Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2108233ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2108233" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1787902">gharper</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-29">03/29/24 15:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Anyone who says this smells cheap is either lying, or expecting too much out of a fragrance. Perhaps the retail is too steep, but on a discounted this is one hell of a purchase. For me the scent is fairly linear, maybe with the dry down being slightly sweeter. Performance is good, definitely masculine because of the woodiness, ambroxan, and spice combo. As for the scent itself, its amazing. But for gatekeeping purposes, this sucks dont buy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2108233"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2108233#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2105929" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2105929" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jbSoFresh"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2074260"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2074260.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jbSoFresh" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2105929ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2105929" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71); It gives me subtle hints of one of my favorites Legend Night Montblanc '17.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2105929"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2105929#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2104129" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2090589" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SmellyFoodie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1906177"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="SmellyFoodie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51742.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lafayette Street"title="Lafayette Street"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2090589ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2090589" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1906177">SmellyFoodie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-12">03/12/24 15:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It smelt very familiar and I couldn't quite place my finger on it. But then I knew. It smells undeniably similar to the Chanel Allure homme line. Trust me. For some reason this fragrance got that chanel thing to it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2090589"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2090589#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2088931" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2088931" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JonahD2009"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2036719"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2036719.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JonahD2009" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51742.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lafayette Street"title="Lafayette Street"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2088931ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2088931" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2036719">JonahD2009</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-11">03/11/24 06:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Great scent profile. Was gifted this on my birthday a couple of days ago, can't get my nose off of it. The atomizer is amazing, sprays in a cone rather than a line, and sprays a lot.<br />
<br />
 The bottle is so beautiful, and I cant stop looking at the packaging. This smells amazing. Perfect apple, ambroxan, bergamot, vanilla blast, all blended perfectly. <br />
<br />
This lasts about 9 hours on me, so  well above average longevity, with it projecting for the first 6-7 hours. Bond no. 9 has truly amazing scents. <br />
<br />
The price, however, is not that cheap, coming in with my father buying it for me in the 250 - 275 dollar range. Because I am not spending my own money on this, I think it is great.  Definitely will repurchase.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2088931"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2088931#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2087463" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I just wanted to go ahead and state the obvious. But if you can get it for a discount. GET IT! This smells . Anytime I wear this its very uplifting and my head is a bout this much  higher. Smells clean, fresh, little sweet, and luxurious. Wear this when you got a fresh cut. Great for white tee attire or suited which I love. padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1657388">hc123</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-06">03/06/24 19:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If we are talking just price Bond no.9 is overpriced this one in particular BUT if we are talking scent profiles I love the house and this one is my favorite so far. I've owned about 80 fragrances and smelled hundreds and I've never smelled a profile quite like this even though its an easy wear. I waited and waited but the price of Lafayette St has just been creeping up on discounters so I pulled the trigger.<br />
<br />
- whats with the caps being all jiggly on $400 dollar bottles Bond no.9??</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2084682"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2084682#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2082383" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; When you first spray it, it smells like Lemon pledge and almost chokes you. After wearing it multiple times I determined its best to hold your breath while you spray it and for a few minutes after or you inhale lemon cleaner. The dry down is nice. Vanilla and powdery. I like the dry down. But its not worth the price. Not even close. Silage is poor on my skin. I dont know what I was expecting from Lafayette street but it was more than this. Cannot imagine paying that kind of money for this fragrance. Glad I tested it before buying it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2082383"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2082383#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2082281" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2082281" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JJ2137"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1882714"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="JJ2137" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2082281ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2082281" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1882714">JJ2137</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-04">03/04/24 15:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is as close a perfume being a scam as it gets. Smells really similar to Jaguar Gold, which is like 15$, maybe smells little smoother and with overall higher quality, but: the box suck, the atomizer suck, sillage and longevity is mediocre (4-6h). Lasts longer on clothes. And it retails for 450$? Who hyped this to 4.4 rating? Nice joke. I paid ~240$ and still feel like I fell victim to some fraud. I would recommend in ~100$ range, because this is a designer scent.<br />
In vacuum this is at least "like" rating, but I give it a "hate" as a sign of protest against this madness.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2082281"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2082281#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2081063" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
