padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2008405">SleepyHaed</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-03">03/03/24 12:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have a sample and it smells just like the bottle I sprayed in store. But the issue is, neither seem to last any longer than 1-2 hours with two sprays (note I did spray on my wrist, as it's easiest for me to sniff after a while and not already be nose blind to it.) and I've asked my family to smell it and they said it was really faint even 30 minutes to an hour ago. They tend to say things are strong even when I can barely smell them with my nose pressed to my wrist. Now, this could obviously just be it not projecting well on my skin, not uncommon. But I don't think it's worth buying, because not only is it weak, but it also smells cheap, when I first applied it, my mom said it smelled like soap you'd find at Walmart. Overall 4/10, smells very nice on paper.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2081063"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2081063#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2077260" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; A Masterpiece!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2071317"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2071317#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2069841" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2069841" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bizzy1995"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1963702"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bizzy1995" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Allure-Homme-523.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.523.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Allure Homme"title="Allure Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2069841ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2069841" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1963702">Bizzy1995</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-21">02/21/24 16:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Nice fresh bergamot opening with soft peppery notes of coriander. As it starts to dry I pick up crisp apple and and overdose of ambroxan mixed with sweetness  vanilla/Tonka. The ambergris adds quite a bit saltiness to this. This is decently blended and to me would make this very versatile frag for any day time or season wear for females. If you are sensitive to the scent of ambroxan this isnt for you</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2069841"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2069841#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2064435" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2059416" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fubar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1995890"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1995890.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fubar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2059416ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2059416" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); I enjoy the patchouli/ apple notes mixing with a sort of ambery musk, making for a good sweet freshie. <br />
If you aren't a fan of citrusy fragrances, not your thing. <br />
IMO better version is Versace Pour Homme ;)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2059416"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2059416#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2056851" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; <br />
Reminded me of a more natural and less sweet Versace Eros. It is a nice scent but its just not so interesting to me, if you like Eros and wish it was more versatile, this is perfect for you. <br />
<br />
Other than that, hefty price tag to what it truly is.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2056851"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2056851#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2044979" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2044979" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Chris6815"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1773075"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Chris6815" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2044979ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2044979" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1773075">Chris6815</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-28">01/28/24 13:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Im glad that I only bought samples of this. It smells pleasant for a little while. My biggest gripe is that it seems really lacking in projection and longevity. Perhaps I go nose blind to it. I would rather wear Sauvage edp, Eros edp or Xerjoff 40 Knots. The other ones I mentioned smell just as good or better and have much better performance for me. Please sample this before blind buying. For the money its way too basic smelling.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2044979"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2044979#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2042958" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2038730" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jlog23"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555933"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1555933.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jlog23" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2038730ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2038730" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555933">jlog23</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-22">01/22/24 13:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Amber Fougeres are one of my favorite type of fragrances. I got this in hope it would be the Rolls Royce of this category. And while it does smell very good, it is 90% the same as sculpture parfum. Sure, the quality of ingredients and blend are better, but this most certainly doesnt justify the price. Ill wear sculpture around the house and the Bond for more social gatherings.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2038730"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2038730#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2035138" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2035138" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bashholt2"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1979239"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="bashholt2" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2035138ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2035138" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1979239">bashholt2</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-18">01/18/24 18:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Floral and fruitier version of Althr<br />
<br />
They have the same middle. Which is the same as Chanel Allure Homme Sport Eau Extreme.<br />
<br />
This is a Detroit Hustler with Cartier frames type of fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2035138"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2035138#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2034017" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2034017" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jhell"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1791062"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jhell" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hez-Parfums/Bourbon-Street-84101.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84101.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bourbon Street"title="Bourbon Street"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2034017ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2034017" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1791062">Jhell</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-17">01/17/24 16:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I like and enjoy wearing it.<br />
My girl loves it and usually compliments me saying "that perfume is nice". <br />
<br />
This and Duas version is like 97 % the same. Tiny bit difference between those, but I cannot tell you what that difference is exactly. Performance is right down the middle (goes for both of them).<br />
<br />
Dont really care about the box, but if you do, dont expect anthing special.<br />
Outer box is ok, inner box where the perfume sits is trash. Nice touch with a note inside, but come on. The cheap arabian clone houses produces better boxes than this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2034017"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2034017#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2033994" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2033994" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Chiguy27"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1763956"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Chiguy27" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2033994ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2033994" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1763956">Chiguy27</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-17">01/17/24 16:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>PROS: Fresh, clean, bright, strong, crowd pleasing, safe easy wear, versatile, screams confidence <br />
<br />
CONS: Expensive for what it is, synthetic, designer scent profile (though niche quality) <br />
<br />
This fragrance has me scratching my head. In one hand I think it's a great fresh citrus scent with some depth and power probably from a huge dose of ambroxan. On first sniff it definitely wowed me with that smack of bright clean citrus. BUT, In the other hand as time went on I was like okay maybe this isn't as special as I had thought. It does smell really synthetic and reminds me of cheaper designer fragrances I've smelled in the past. And I think thats where the problem lies, IN THE PRICE. I could never in a million years justify the retail price of this one. It just isn't special enough for me. That being said if you could find it on good discount I say go for it! It will have you smelling undeniably amazing and I can't imagine anyone being put off by this scent. 8/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2033994"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2033994#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2026459" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Though quite durable</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2024227"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2024227#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2020975" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2020975" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="andrewpc84"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1428280"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1428280.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="andrewpc84" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/19-69/Christopher-Street-69472.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69472.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Christopher Street"title="Christopher Street"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2020975ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2020975" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1428280">andrewpc84</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-05">01/05/24 03:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>City nights vibe, not a country boy scent  a refreshing blend of citrus with sweet amber tones, exuding a super sexy and masculine appeal. Combines green fruity and vanilla notes, pulling lots of complimentsfrom the ladies. While not the most unique, it evolves like Diesel Plus Plus for Men, a favorite. It's akin to a more niche version of Diesel Plus Plus.<br />
<br />
Catering to various ages, it gives off a sexy clubbing sillage perhaps less suitable for younger individuals. Enthusiasts appreciating an effervescent opening will find this fragrance distinctive. Though it excels in its class, the originality falls short for the price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2020975"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2020975#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2015459" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It honestly feels like I am in a dream. I don't know what else to say I am out of words for this thing, love at first sniff and it is definitely one of my favorites now. padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2014757" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Aramouis"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1466948"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1466948.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Aramouis" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Babycat-73149.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.73149.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Babycat"title="Babycat"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2014757ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2014757" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); Sexy, light-hearted fresh sweet citrus vibes. Hints of Versace Dreamer. Cloying on drydown (just like Dreamer). I think like Dreamer better, irrespective of price. Spring/Summer/Fall</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2014757"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2014757#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2010929" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2010929" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LukeWoj"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1798232"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1798232.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LukeWoj" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2010929ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2010929" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); I remember trying a little tester at my closest retail store and got a whiff of citrusy when first sprayed on the strip. When I got home I took it out again and it turned into this woody masculine scent that was versatile I knew I had to have it.<br />
<br />
Amazing fragrance and LOVED BY WOMEN. Every single woman I have been with has seemed to absolutely love this fragrance. Crazy lady puller.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2010929"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2010929#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2009677" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2009677" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Garchynx"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1862005"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1862005.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Garchynx" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Imaginary-Authors/Memoirs-Of-A-Trespasser-16545.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.16545.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Memoirs Of A Trespasser"title="Memoirs Of A Trespasser"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2009677ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2009677" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1862005">Garchynx</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-24">12/24/23 12:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love this fragrance, my second favorite from Bond No9.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2009677"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2009677#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2001861" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2001861" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Thatbwoy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1371788"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1371788.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Thatbwoy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Moschino/Toy-Boy-55858.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55858.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Toy Boy"title="Toy Boy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2001861ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2001861" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1371788">Thatbwoy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-15">12/15/23 06:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Erm<br />
<br />
I wanted to sample this asand Im kinda embarrassed to sayI had seen a lot of rappers, actors and athletes talk about it.<br />
<br />
Normally, ordinarily and as a quantifier thats a RED FLAG for me, especially if (no offence) theyre American or English Footballers.<br />
<br />
But there was every chance that I would like it.<br />
<br />
I dont hate it, but I also dont like it. I have just a very clear understanding that my assumptions on the clutch of people are not to be trusted. Actually maybe their stylists shouldnt be trusted.<br />
<br />
This is not a particularly exceptional fragrance; its ok. I know I wouldnt buy this for the RRP I dont think a decent discount would tempt me. The price itself is not the thing that puts me off. Im just not moved or stirred towards buying a fragrance like this.<br />
<br />
This is a very nice scent but also very generic. Its like a really good body spray. Like if Lynx/Axe created a pricier version of their own products. The quality is good but the problem I have with it is it just sticks around- I know thats an odd thing to say, but it just doesnt do anything its very annoyingly linear and unremarkable for what it its presenting itself to be.<br />
<br />
Its clean fresh and not as interesting as the hype around it demands. If you want to pay for the fact that you can drop it into conversation that you own it - fair enough. If on the other hand you just want to smell very nice then you are spoilt for choice out there as theres loads that smell like this.<br />
<br />
6.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2001861"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2001861#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1999376" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1999376" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Christos08"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1816892"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Christos08" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1999376ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1999376" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1816892">Christos08</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-12">12/12/23 09:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful clean well blended fragrance I'm beginning to really love bond no.9 fragrances I have Lafayette street and Sutton place. They deliver decent performance I would place them somewhere between designer and niche, reason being longevity is not as strong as say Amouage or parfums de marly. But these are really modern scents and the bottles are fantastic really outside the box in terms of design. I would definitely buy these 2 again and I hope to collect more from the house in the near future. Absolutely love them 9 out of 10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1999376"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1999376#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1986002" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1986002" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BTScents12"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1902859"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="BTScents12" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1986002ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1986002" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1902859">BTScents12</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-26">11/26/23 17:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Man oh man I hate to be that guy but this just flat-out smells amazing. Is it a bit synthetic? yes. Is it on the expensive side? yes but this kind of reminds me of Amouage Reflection Man. Sweet florals with a little bit of the oriental spices coming through, also have some freshness with the apple and bergamot. The vanilla base rounds this out to make it a FLAT OUT LADY KILLER! I Have a good amount of fragrances but I think this is the one I would pick for my signature scent. Smells strong, fresh and sweet, and can be worn in all 4 seasons. (adjust the sprays accordingly) also can be worn by women, as one of the most versatile niche fragrances that I can think of. I get about 7-8 hours of longevity and get compliments frequently with this if you cant afford it right now just sample.<br />
<br />
For more reviews like this subscribe to my YouTube Channel: BTscents</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1986002"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1986002#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1984096" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1858333">Wormleyyy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-25">10/25/23 12:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I personally enjoy this fragrance. One of my first from the Bond No. 9 house. I will be looking to get more in the future from this house. Lafayette street is a lady killer for sure. Woman seem to love this even though it isnt groundbreaking when I smell it but its a fantastic scent nonetheless. My wife always compliments me when I wear this one. To my nose it isnt the greatest scent Ive smelled but it seems to be a favorite for women so thats more important at least for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; It smells DELICIOUS. Im going to give my sample to my boyfriend.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1958484"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1958484#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1941215" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1941215" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CaliMiXers"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1826373"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1826373.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CaliMiXers" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Apple-Brandy-on-the-Rocks-68326.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68326.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Apple Brandy on the Rocks"title="Apple Brandy on the Rocks"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1941215ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1941215" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1826373">CaliMiXers</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-30">09/30/23 14:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is absolutely hot and intoxicating. When my boyfriend wears this Im all over him. Im more of a fresh, floral, semi sweet lover and this is very well balanced. Its giving clean, masculine &amp; yummy vibes. Great for date night, Formal events, business attire but can be worn casually during the day as well. The longevity is also wonderful &amp; Definitely worth the price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1941215"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1941215#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1933181" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1933181" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nbazza"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1379491"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="nbazza" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1933181ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1933181" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1379491">nbazza</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-20">09/20/23 20:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>THIS IS HOT! I am writing without looking at the other reviews as I want to just write what I think without letting any other opinions affect me, as this is a scent that will probably get mixed reviews as it's unexpected and is different to Sag Harbour, Coney Island, etc... but it is oh so sexy. On first smell, this took my by surprise because 1. It is very unique and sexy and 2. it's quite different to the rest of the Bonds (I have a deluxe sample set and am revisiting them). I could see a man that would break your heart wearing this - like a smooth talker Casanova type. It is really doing something to me physically. It's a confident scent that smells fresh, a little green/herbal but there is something feminine leaning. After looking this up I can see it's the vanilla and tonka bean which is breutifully mixed. Only the bold women would wear this scent but it COULD go unisex. However, I see a man really rocking this one. It's the sort of scent that will truly elevate someone and is an unforgettable, unique scent. It's VEERRRYYYY SEXY. This is the sort of man that would break your heart and at the same time it's an 'I don't give a f---' scent - maybe you like me, maybe you don't, maybe I'll grow on you. Now that I said that, perhaps it's giving me Ryan Gosling vibes in Crazy Stupid Love as he was a smooth talker who ended up succeeding in seducing his love interest who initially was rejecting him, and then they fell in love. It is unique so I would think it'll get mixed reviews, but it will grow on people as the charm is there. I highly recommend this. It's something you will get used to and be addicted to. It's seductive. High end dinner recommended? yes. Bedtime recommended? a big yes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1933181"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1933181#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1933099" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1933099" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BlueMoon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/601683"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="BlueMoon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1933099ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1933099" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/601683">BlueMoon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-20">09/20/23 17:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's still a 'NO-GO'<br />
<br />
I tried Bond No. 9 fragrances many years ago, and I thought they smelled like mass marketed designer fragrances. Too synthetic and un-refined.<br />
<br />
My nephew sampled Lafayette and recommended I give Bond another chance.<br />
<br />
Uh...no.<br />
<br />
My POV has not changed. Niche price for a mass appeal synthetic designer fragrance. <br />
<br />
In this price range there are much better options for a fresh, refined, and easy-to-wear.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1933099"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1933099#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1920418" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1920418" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AhmedElbahja95"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1793463"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1793463.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AhmedElbahja95" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1920418ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1920418" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1793463">AhmedElbahja95</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-05">09/05/23 12:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Well, well, well. Lafayette Street by Bond No 9 is gorgeous unisex fragrance that's very easily wearable. I got it for myself but I find my wife reaching for it also. I think performance is average, I would say it is moderate at best. However, that is not an issue, it can be reapplied without being overbearing. I think Lafayette Street is suitable for all occasions and seasons. This is a must try if you want a niche scent from a famous house thats unique but also has a lot of wearability. I give this 9/10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1920418"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1920418#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1916196" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; This is basically Xerjoff Uden with airy sweet freshness and less creamy...and I really adore it! The wife couldn't take her nose off of my neck, lol, which is probably a sign that I should buy a bottle. Now, if only I can bring myself to look past my first statement. One of these days...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1916196"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1916196#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1914042" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1515487">hussrahal</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-28">08/28/23 22:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Easy reach banger.<br />
<br />
Unique scent is what makes it worth the price tag for me. I have 50 fragrances but nothing smells like this. It got better on me every single day that I wore it. <br />
<br />
Must try if you want a niche scent thats unique but also has a lot of wearability.<br />
<br />
Nothing better than an expensive scent that I dont have to save for special occasions, especially in such a big collection.<br />
<br />
9/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1914042"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1914042#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1913967" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Smells like the original formula of that cleaning product. Its not bad but it doesnt last. Its meh.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1913967"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1913967#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1908282" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1908282" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="L8Apex"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1670707"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1670707.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="L8Apex" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/De-Los-Santos-72693.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72693.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="De Los Santos"title="De Los Santos"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1908282ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1908282" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1670707">L8Apex</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-21">08/21/23 23:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A good friend of mine is a partner at one of the Big Four, a man of wealth and taste. We see each other when a group of us gets together for drinks once or twice a month, and when we all got together last month he asked me if I was wearing Lafayette St. Which I was. This is a distinct and luxurious smelling fragrance, great for casual nighttime use during the warmer months. As with Chez Bond a little but goes a long way. If the bottles won't so damn goofy looking with the wingspan of an NBA center I'd explore more of their catalog.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1908282"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1908282#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1905137" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1905137" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kadafi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1219214"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1219214.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kadafi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Zoologist-Perfumes/Panda-Edition-2017-45873.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45873.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Panda Edition 2017"title="Panda Edition 2017"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1905137ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1905137" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1219214">Kadafi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-18">08/18/23 06:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A bit sweet, kinda fresh with some floral. Everything comes together to make a lovely mass appealing aroma. <br />
<br />
Ultimate Playboy scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1905137"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1905137#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1897768" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1897768" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JusttheFactsMan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1733487"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1733487.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JusttheFactsMan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bois-1920/Itruk-32129.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.32129.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Itruk"title="Itruk"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1897768ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1897768" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1733487">JusttheFactsMan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-09">08/09/23 07:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>#203 in my "Tour de Fragrance"<br />
<br />
I won't waste lot of time on this one. It's Dunhill Desire Red in a cool bottle at 10X the price. Total sucker play. This is my second Bond No 9 fragrance and I'm seeing a pattern form here where they put out something with a fizzy opening, which I admit is unique, then it dries down to a scent you've smelled before out of a bottle of something in the under $30 range, in this case a Dunhill scent that I gave away even though it wasn't a bad buy at $23 a bottle on Gift Express. But $300+??? Heard the saying, "I was born at night, but not last night?"</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1897768"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1897768#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1892575" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Absolutely love it. It's one of those scents you can pick out from a room and know exactly what it is</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1892575"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1892575#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1889513" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1889513" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="devin7"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1165627"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1165627.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="devin7" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Benetton/United-Dreams-Men-Be-Strong-31631.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31631.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="United Dreams Men Be Strong "title="United Dreams Men Be Strong "></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1889513ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1889513" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1165627">devin7</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-28">07/28/23 21:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have trouble keeping track of all the Bond fragrances. <br />
I absolutely love the NYC names (although if I had to make an actual fragrance from the years I lived there it would be a mix of burnt woodchips, honey roasted peanuts with a hint of last night's garbage). <br />
The sheer number of choices has actually made me tune out to Bond but tried Lafayette the other day and absolutely loved it. The citrus drew me in, the apple and vanilla kept my attention an hour or two later and now the Tonka Bean has me relaxed and ready to start the weekend. <br />
Sweet, fun, energetic; sort of how I used to be when I was a few years younger and walking the streets of NYC.  <br />
Lafayette came out of nowhere, sort of like the tall, brunette standing 2 poles down on the F Train that got off at my stop and gave me her number to hang out that night. Totally came out of nowhere and  I still remember 15 years later. Iget the feeling Lafayette is the same surprise and I'm going to end up buying a bottle of it. Just too much energy and excitement in that bottle to resist.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1889513"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1889513#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1888055" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1858767" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="maxpowerboston"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1089734"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1089734.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="maxpowerboston" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1858767ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1858767" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1089734">maxpowerboston</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-17">06/17/23 19:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If youve smelled Nikos Sculpture, Minotaure, Dunhill Desire Redyouve basically smelled this. Wake Up World is the modern, higher end version of these and feels a bit higher end than Lafayette. Fruity, aldehydes with a Woody base. <br />
<br />
Longevity was 7-9 hours. <br />
<br />
A 7.5/10. Its not bad as I love that profile and its very 90s memories to me. But even at $200 for 100ml on the grey market I find this about 5x overpriced.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1858767"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1858767#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1852515" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
