Thats a no for me dawg</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1852515"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1852515#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1820885" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1820885" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sunnydndutches17"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1295160"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1295160.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sunnydndutches17" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1820885ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1820885" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1295160">sunnydndutches17</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-29">04/29/23 13:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is probably the most overpriced fragrance I ever smelled. I got a 10ML sample and it literally smells like walking into a macys / Uomo signature. Its sweet and synthetic and theres no way this is worth $300. For like 30 bucks sure, but was expecting wayyy more. Just a gentrified Uomo signature.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1820885"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1820885#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1803037" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1803037" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nate_915"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1556167"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1556167.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nate_915" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1803037ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1803037" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1556167">Nate_915</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-07">04/07/23 11:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This doesnt smell like Layton, but if you like Layton, this is something youd probably enjoy in warmer weather when Layton might be too heavy. Opening is kind of fruity and flowery, and then the vanilla/woody notes come into play a bit after it dries down.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1803037"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1803037#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1801659" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1801659" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="amudrechenko"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1708795"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1708795.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="amudrechenko" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1801659ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1801659" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1708795">amudrechenko</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-05">04/05/23 21:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance is very unique and I haven't smelled yet anything like that. It's fresh, leathery, soapy, fruity and woody - all at the same time. It smells like an expensive car with leathery seats and a luxury diffuser inside. It definitely has some "catchy" notes that are reminiscent of designer fragrances, like the woody notes and the sweet vanilla-leaning tonka beans. It's opening is bright fruits which is also considered pretty generic, but it's heart is incredibly unique. It's soapy and rich, it's intoxicating and addictive, it's pleasant and thoughtful and it creates a huge bubble around you of this unusual luxury atmosphere. For me Lafayette street is still a pass due to it's heavy masculine and edgy nature (I prefer more feminine-leaning perfumes), but I still fell in love with it and would love to smell this scent on others.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; The question is...is it worth the money?<br />
For me Yes, Ive tried the fragrances pll say it smells like and thats all fine and dandy...but the smell cheap, i rather have a high quality product</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; That apple keeps it check on my skin, the florals mix so well with the vanilla...this was blended so well... I'm late to the party but dammit WE HERE!!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1772648"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1772648#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1762110" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Got two compliments. One while standing in line at Chipotle the first day I wore it, and at night from my friend who was in the car with me.  Never received a reaction like this from any of the designer fragrances that I own and I have almost 100 bottles of designers.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1762110"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1762110#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1759131" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1580375">dantek121</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-13">02/13/23 11:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I blind bought this and am really impressed. Say what you will but this is blowing me away as I am wearing it at my desk. I keep smelling my wrists and get completely distracted whenever I get a whiff in the air. If I had to compare it to something I have experience with, it would probably be YSL Y Le Parfum. 10/10 and the best Bond 9 that I've smelled so far.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1759131"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1759131#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1757579" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1757579" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nathan17"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1664535"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1664535.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nathan17" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1757579ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1757579" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1664535">Nathan17</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-11">02/11/23 09:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The dry down smells a lot like Ralphs Club to me, which many people say smells like Y Le Parfum, which I have only smelled once and I cant remember a lot about it. But besides the dry down this is very different and it is very good and so strong. Performance is about 8 hours and sillage is a few feet. It is definitely a compliment getter for both men and women. Definitely not worth the 400 bucks or whatever it goes for retail, Id say more in the 100-200 range.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1757579"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1757579#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1732658" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1732658" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="DaylanB1000"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/968656"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="DaylanB1000" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1732658ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1732658" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/968656">DaylanB1000</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-12">01/12/23 19:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the 2nd time a fragrance that I didnt think was worth it but it ended up growing on me. (First time being sauvage when it was the new kid on the block and folks handed out compliments for it left and right.) Lafayette st is a nice floral,fruity, fresh(in a starchy kind of way) vibe that can be pulled off all season. I test drove this during a cold front here in Texas (17-30 degrees Fahrenheit) and it stuck with me all day each time i wore. I noticed however that in the spring-summer climates is where this takes off. I get compliments everytime I wear it when its around or above 70 degrees. <br />
<br />
Lafayette St (as well as the other bond no.9s) has this thing where it lies to my nose. I dont think Im projecting at all until someone 4-6 feet away says I smell delicious.  Does it smell good? YES! Is it a safe blind buy? YES but not for your wallet. And for the guys out there: Women will most likely LOVE this one you than you like it on yourself. Ambergris/ambroxan is cat nip for the ladies<br />
<br />
I hear it smells like Dunhill desire or something like that but I also heard that it was reformulated into irrelevancy too so Id rather just save up for another bottle of this to be honest</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1557746">TM99</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-14">12/14/22 13:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Great, versatile scent I can not imagine anyone not liking... As for the comparisons to Nikos Sculpture, it is similar but in a way you would say Aventus is similar to Montblanc Explorer or Original Santal is similar to Montblanc Individuel... The scent is just much richer and although Bond No9 use quite a lot of synthetics it is still very smooth. Performance is amazing and you can get it on discounters for a really good price (170 was the deal I got) and it is a steal at that price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; Nothing like it and therefore, nothing to compare to. It stands alone and very proudly at that!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1708673"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1708673#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1705160" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Bond no 9 fragrances are a hit or miss. A sweet apple, ambery, and tonka blast. For a teenager and young guy this is definitely a Eau De Parfum hit for them. For sure its not worth the $300, more like $60.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1705160"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1705160#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1694230" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1694230" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Darokes85"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1293316"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1293316.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Darokes85" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/Gentle-Fluidity-Silver-53400.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53400.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gentle Fluidity Silver"title="Gentle Fluidity Silver"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1694230ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1694230" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1293316">Darokes85</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-22">11/22/22 22:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It took a while but Ive fallen in love with this fragrance! My initial impression was that Lafayette St was a smoother, well blended, higher quality Dunhill Desire Blue that I used to wear in high school. It wasnt bad but for almost $500 I was expecting a lot more. I finally gave this fragrance a full wear and no lie, I went to an art show in Chicago and I was getting complimented by everyone who came within 4 feet of me. Men and women alike! The bergamot, floral notes and apple give the composition a fresh brightness, while the coriander, ambroxan and ambergris provide a sexy musky quality and the vanilla sweetens it, but not too excessively, just enough to keep the fragrance masculine and appealing. It gives me the impression of a man whos very sexual and virile but restrains his fiery passions behind a cool, classy and gentlemanly facade. Is it worth the price? Hell no! Theres fragrances that smell similar for a fraction of the price, but none is as well blended, smooth and high quality as this juice. Besides, Ive already spent the money lol. If you can find this discounted, Id say go for it! Its definitely worth it. But I wouldnt recommend buying at retail</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1694230"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1694230#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1691185" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1691185" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MThunder"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1592365"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="MThunder" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/La-Nuit-de-L-Homme-Bleu-Electrique-67997.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67997.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Nuit de L'Homme Bleu lectrique"title="La Nuit de L'Homme Bleu lectrique"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1691185ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1691185" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1592365">MThunder</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-18">11/18/22 10:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Found a 100ml at a discounters for a little over $200. With the retail price this is going at I figured ok blind buy time! Well it arrived in the mail, and lets just say, this is at best a $75 designer fragrance with ok performance. Dont get me wrong, I actually think it smells pretty good, definitely mass appealing and true unisex. If Dior Sauvage were to be have a womens version, this would definitely be it, minus the loudness. Sweet tonka and ambroxan with a hint of woodsiness. The floral and fruitiness in the opening gives it that femme vibe, and the mids you have caramel apple.<br />
<br />
Id rather smell this on a female than wear it myself. Performance I only get about 4-6 hours with so-so projection. Which is strange for a fragrance with ambroxan. The skin scent turns woodsy all of a sudden though. Think of this scenario. Youre on a second or third date with a girl and youre hanging out, shopping, a movie or having lunch, casual stuff. Youre enjoying whiffs of Lafayette on her. Then she says, lets go back to my place, and youre thinking Score!. You start canoodling and then you smell the woodsy aroma on her skin and all of a sudden youre wondering where that delightful sweet fruity scent went, and why is this masculine woodsiness here. Now youre distracted!<br />
<br />
Do I regret this blind buy? Yes, because its overpriced even for what I paid, which is the reason I cant seem to enjoy the fragrance. I may gift it to a female friend. Bond no 9 has been trying to create a high fashion image in the fragrance category, with high fashion prices. What they lack in juice quality they try to make up in bottle design and presentation, and amping the image up with inflated prices. Last time I blind buy on emotion and perceived savings. (Yeah right!)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1691185"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1691185#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1690640" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1690640" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="aaronmy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1530551"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="aaronmy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Day-Three/Escandalo-94878.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.94878.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Escndalo"title="Escndalo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1690640ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1690640" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1530551">aaronmy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-17">11/17/22 15:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This gives me clean sheets vibes, similar to Oud Satin Mood, but without the oud. Instead of this smelling like satin, I imagine this as something like clean cotton sheets. Unfortunately, I enjoy Ambre Nuit much more and this comes off a little sharp on my nose. This is very good and I would recommend giving this a smell.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1690640"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1690640#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1684272" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1684272" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Squishyy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1403891"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1403891.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Squishyy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/BondNo9-com-18133.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18133.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="BondNo9.com"title="BondNo9.com"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1684272ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1684272" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1403891">Squishyy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-08">11/08/22 19:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lafayette Street is the new king of my 70-bottle collection. Layton, Aventus, etc. this bests them all for me.<br />
<br />
The top notes mix with the delicious green apple to give it almost a 'Fruity Mentos' accord. IYKYK. I absolutely adore this, as it reminds me of the many times as a kid when my parents took me to the symphony where they always would treat us with Mentos. To me, this is the scent of a time when everything felt right! Also, the vanilla is very present throughout. Incredibly mouthwatering stuff.<br />
<br />
I also own and love Uden, which has a similar profile. Uden is more soapy, a better fit for an out-of-the-shower feel, and has more of a couch vibe. I cannot wear Uden when I am active, as I've found it becomes cloying. Lafayette Street does not have this issue, perhaps being saved from how they did the Ambroxan here. I can never see myself wearing this and not loving every second of it. <br />
<br />
Despite having what you could call a 'familiar' scent profile, I don't think I've had my jaw drop this hard over something since the first time I sprayed Sauvage as a meatball 18-yo. This scent is literally me. Perfect 10/10!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1684272"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1684272#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1678360" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1678360" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Glyph"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1312716"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1312716.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Glyph" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Santal-Majuscule-15547.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15547.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Santal Majuscule"title="Santal Majuscule"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1678360ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1678360" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1312716">Glyph</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-31">10/31/22 21:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is very contemporary, with notes you find very frequently (especially apple) in men's fragrances of its era. Women seem to really go crazy for this, in part, I would guess, because of the marked use of ambroxan. It's quite clean and pleasant, like a much, much softer version of Layton, and it would make a fine office scent because it's noticeable but not oppressive (it wears very lightly). As the reviewer right below me notes, this seems like a mass-appealing designer fragrance more than a niche house fragrance... but it retains an expensive niche house price. This is enjoyable, but absolutely not worth the price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1678360"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1678360#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1675461" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1675461" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JamesGamez"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1521295"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1521295.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JamesGamez" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1675461ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1675461" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1521295">JamesGamez</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-27">10/27/22 10:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells good, but really does have that mass appealing designer vibe. <br />
Its clean, fresh, a little citrusy, and just a bit sweet. <br />
I enjoy it, not sure if I would buy a FB though.<br />
<br />
Edit - Havent seen anyone else mention it but when it dries down it smells like smarties, with some freshness to it.<br />
<br />
Update - I ending up falling in love with this and purchasing it lol!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1675461"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1675461#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1635497" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1635497" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Freshthesmell"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1528724"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Freshthesmell" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51742.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lafayette Street"title="Lafayette Street"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1635497ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1635497" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1528724">Freshthesmell</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-31">08/31/22 21:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Mass pleasing. Women really do love this scent. Not my favorite but very good .</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1635497"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1635497#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1612474" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1612474" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="muh.sqk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1189597"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1189597.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="muh.sqk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1612474ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1612474" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1189597">muh.sqk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-28">07/28/22 15:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bond no 9 is one of those houses which keeps the consistency in terms of quality, longevity and silage. I will be forever their loyal client as long they keep making this scent which brings my favorite of all time Desire DNA scent without headache inducing alcohol. I keep buying this bottle every month or so and I wont stop. Its the only type close to the original Desire DNA.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1612474"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1612474#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1580464" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1580464" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sam303"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1516983"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sam303" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1580464ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1580464" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1516983">Sam303</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-08">06/08/22 15:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I defend GIT and Chez Bond over Cool Water, but I just can't do it here: Lafayette St. is Nikos Sculpture. Yes, it's a little bit smoother and deeper as an EDP, but let's not fool ourselves into thinking there's a $400 difference. Dunhill Desire is also similar.<br />
<br />
They all have effervescent orange creamsicle openings that head in a sweet-floral direction. They smell great and unique at first glance until you realize they resemble each other and suffocate with sweetness over time. I think the composition leans feminine -- it reminds me of an elementary school teacher who overdoes it with perfume in her classroom. <br />
<br />
If you're curious about the scent profile, buy Sculpture for $14. If you love Sculpture, buy another bottle of Sculpture. Lafayette is smooth and well-done, but it's also unoriginal, dramatically overpriced, and too sweet for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1580464"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1580464#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1572368" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1572368" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Zactel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1460903"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1460903.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Zactel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1572368ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1572368" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1460903">Zactel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-27">05/27/22 16:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lets adress the elephant in the room. This scent DNA is not original and the scent has already been out two decades ago and if you have smelled dunhill red desire, it is extremely similar. BUT, this fragrance has VERY good performance and better and more expensive blend I get 8+ hours longevity and loud projection the first hours and then it tames down I use 3 sprays as this one can be cloying if oversprayed. But at retail cost, this is a big no go. If you like the scent but cant afford this even at discounters I suggest to buy dunhill red desire as it is very similar and no one will tell the difference in the air in the first hour. why the first hour? Because dunhill red desire has poor performance and after that very few people will smell it in the air.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1572368"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1572368#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1566161" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1566161" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nbazza"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1379491"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="nbazza" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1566161ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1566161" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); Like a guy that loves to flirt and knows he has girls after him. It is masculine but also quite sweet and very citrusy. The Vanilla, Ambroxian, Tonka bean and flowers give a very interesting twist. Bond fragrances are so interesting with their unique mixes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1566161"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1566161#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1552562" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/211833">flossbee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-28">04/28/22 07:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The third bottle of Bond I've added to my collection behind The Signature Scent and New Haarlem. Lafayette St. has sprinted to the forefront with a commanding lead! This stuff is greatness in a bottle. I get heavy sherbet vibes with this one, but in the absolute best way possible. I love a scent that you just can't wait to spray on because you know every time you get a waft of it it's going to brighten your day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1522113"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1522113#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1521928" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1521928" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Manny44"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/689591"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.689591.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="Manny44" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Dior-Homme-2020-58714.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.58714.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dior Homme 2020"title="Dior Homme 2020"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1521928ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1521928" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/689591">Manny44</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-12">03/12/22 13:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First things first. At retail Bond prices, it's an absolute no-go. If you love spicy powdery fragrances, then this one is a great quality one. For me, I don't quite love that genre enough or this fragrance in particular enough to buy a full bottle or keep buying decants. Very good quality as I said but not $330 for 100ml good.<br />
Edit: OMG, the scent descriptions on this page are all over the place and I had a very different experience than other reviewers. What I get is in the same family as other male-oriented white florals like Reflection Man and JPG Fleur de Male or Le Male minus the mint.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1521928"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1521928#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1509389" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1509389" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="FAST"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1106123"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="FAST" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1509389ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1509389" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1106123">FAST</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-21">02/21/22 21:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Just got this today.<br />
<br />
This smell almost exactly like woods and spice but to my nose less of a chemical mess than that one. I once enjoyed woods and spice but after a while sold it as it gave me a headache. Also smells like that jaguar yellow bottle but higher quality.<br />
<br />
Longevity seems like it will be good but I think woods and spice is still a bit stronger. <br />
<br />
I would still recommend woods and spice since it really isnt that far off from it and cheaper (although still pricey since its still a niche)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1509389"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1509389#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1505925" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1505925" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="5Million"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1180007"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="5Million" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Prada/Prada-Amber-Pour-Homme-Intense-11240.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11240.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Prada Amber Pour Homme Intense"title="Prada Amber Pour Homme Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1505925ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1505925" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1180007">5Million</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-16">02/16/22 20:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was so hyped and ready to get this. I could not wait after seeing all the reviews. I get a sample and all I can smell is Mentos candy and green rubbing alcohol mixed together. Dont like it Im moving on to the next try from Bond 9. So far done tried about 8 of them and I dont like any. Next I guess Ill try Bond9.com</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1505925"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1505925#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1500572" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1500572" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lmuradian"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/879102"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.879102.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lmuradian" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1500572ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1500572" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/879102">Lmuradian</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-09">02/09/22 00:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The niche version of Versace the dreamer. 79 percent dreamer which happens to be in the dry down and a fruity mass appealing fresh top with sweetness carrying it to the dry down. Very nice for a bond frag. Still bleaker street is the houses best.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1500572"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1500572#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1493343" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1493343" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Hinoki134"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1452110"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Hinoki134" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1493343ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1493343" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1452110">Hinoki134</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-29">01/29/22 03:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This just doesnt come off like anything else. Starting off with a wild and proactive top and middle and base and for at least 3 hour   down after 5 -7 when it starts to fade away it still keeps a base of tones of tonka beans, amber, with notes also like coriander and and a light mix of apple and clean woods. The first 30 minutes are special. From hour 1 to say 5 its mass appealing brings a fashionable and personable wild outdoorsy like a eclitic flower garden mixed with apple bergamot vanilla coriander and Carmel lightly the cleanest light smells of interesting woods brought together with ambergris ambroxen and tonka beans</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1493343"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1493343#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1484848" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1484848" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="The Wolf"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1263755"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1263755.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="The Wolf" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gucci/Hortus-Sanitatis-59838.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.59838.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hortus Sanitatis"title="Hortus Sanitatis"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1484848ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1484848" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1263755">The Wolf</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-17">01/17/22 03:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have thoroughly tested the DNA of Lafayette side by side with Montale Spice and Wood, Dunhill Desire Red, Nikos Sculpture and Diesel Plus Plus. It's also said to be similar to Versace The Dreamer which I love, but there's only maybe 15 to 20% similarity to Dreamer. <br />
<br />
I mainly get Vanilla, Tonka, light spices, some soft creamy woods, and sweetened red apples .<br />
<br />
The difference with Lafayette is it's got a brighter, higher quality opening due better bergamot used. Otherwise it's closest to Dunhill and identical in the mid and drydown.<br />
Dunhill lasted slightly longer on my skin and smells more synthetic.<br />
<br />
<br />
Final Verdict: The best version of this DNA is Montal Spice and Wood. If you're on a budget get the Dunhill, as it costs 1/30th the price of Lafayette.<br />
<br />
Scent 6.5/10<br />
Performance 7/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1484848"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1484848#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1474309" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1474309" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Isaiah3000"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1341645"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Isaiah3000" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1474309ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1474309" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1341645">Isaiah3000</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-01">01/01/22 07:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Two words: Strength and Beauty! This fragrance blew me away upon first sniff. I purchased a sample and wore it on skin which confirmed the awesomeness. Now that I have a full bottle Ive made it my signature scent. It has a bright variety of florals such as Jasmine, but its not ephemeral at all. Its very strong and projects. I never thought that I would love a floral scent but this beauty was a game-changer for me. I bought my bottle from a discounter but would also gladly pay retail if I have to.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1474309"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1474309#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1468329" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1460692" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="greenclay02"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1160607"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="greenclay02" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1460692ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1460692" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); It smells far too close to dunhill desire. Has the same overbearing candy apply vibe.  Perhaps there are some subtle differences between the two, but to the average nose this smells pretty much the same. I could see a woman in her 30's or 40's wearing this out at day or night time, but regrettably, to me this falls in the shadows of many others that I would go to first.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex;
