Wearing a pinstripe, three piece suit. Corner office with a view. Working through deals.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1428733"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1428733#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1416691" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1416691" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RayCashhhh"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1295740"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1295740.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="RayCashhhh" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Eau-d-Ombre-Leather-95389.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.95389.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau d'Ombr Leather"title="Eau d'Ombr Leather"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1416691ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1416691" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1295740">RayCashhhh</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-25">09/25/21 06:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>In some ways, I feel like this is the niche version of Sauvage: it features ambroxan, mass appealing, and the ladies adore it. It does have a bit of a feminine touch to it, but it's definitely masculine. It smells EXACTLY like the spray my barber applies to me after he finishes cutting my hair. My only issue with it is that it doesn't seem to last long on my skin. I'm not sure if this is marketed as a "barbershop fragrance", but it's certainly one of the best.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1416691"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1416691#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1378069" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1378069" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CNCxFRAGHEAD"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1266532"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1266532.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CNCxFRAGHEAD" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1378069ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1378069" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1266532">CNCxFRAGHEAD</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-07-18">07/18/21 22:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Nikos Sculpture.......that is all</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1378069"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1378069#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1350948" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1350948" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="DarlingNikki"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/6977"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.6977.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="DarlingNikki" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1350948ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1350948" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/6977">DarlingNikki</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-28">05/28/21 23:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So glad that someone else sees this as a unisex/leaning masculine (but not overly so) fragrance like I do!  I was pleasantly surprised by the freshness of the opening which remained throughout the life of the fragrance (at least on the cotton pad I tested it out on).  It reminds me so much of other fragrances, of fragments of them, and I find that appealing. I get a definite Bleu de Chanel EDP vibe in the opening (the freshness of citrus mixing with a woodier supportive base) and then I smell the sweetness of Tom Ford Noir Pour Femme from the tonka and vanilla, but much more subdued than TF NPF.  I also get an interesting hint of chewy tobacco, similar to the tobacco smell from 1 Million Prive (my baby!).  There's more familiarity to this, too, and I really am enjoying the smell lingering after the dry down.  I feel like this is a nice mishmash of scents and that a woman might be able to carry this off without getting too many funny looks lol.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1350948"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1350948#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1346124" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Nothing incredible, and for the price I wouldnt buy it. But its the type of smell that everyone will like. No WOW factor.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1320617"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1320617#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1313858" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1290518" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="clintjr82"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/600617"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.600617.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="clintjr82" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bottega-Veneta/Parco-Palladiano-V-Lauro-38267.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38267.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Parco Palladiano V: Lauro"title="Parco Palladiano V: Lauro"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1290518ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1290518" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/600617">clintjr82</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-10">02/10/21 19:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells pleasant, all Apple, Amber and Tonka.  Nothing unique, just mass a appealing fragrance from Bond no 9. You can find a lot of designer scents with Apple and Tonka that matches this at liquidated prices compared to this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1290518"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1290518#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1284046" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1284046" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="e2less"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1290667"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1290667.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="e2less" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nishane/Nanshe-64093.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64093.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Nanshe"title="Nanshe"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1284046ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1284046" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1290667">e2less</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-29">01/29/21 21:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bond No 9 Lafayette Street is a winner for me. It starts off with a blast of fresh/clean citrus amber with a sweet vanilla ... kinda zingy or fizzy. Image opening a Sprite (vanilla) soda. The mid tones becomes candy like with a light musky woody dry down. The projection is very loud at first so control your sprays. Lets just say I'll spray 3x next time (cough cough).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1284046"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1284046#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1279898" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1279898" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ColorOfFragrance"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1297938"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1297938.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ColorOfFragrance" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Indemodables/Vanille-Havane-63395.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.63395.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanille Havane"title="Vanille Havane"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1279898ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1279898" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1297938">ColorOfFragrance</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-22">01/22/21 06:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ive been off and on with collecting fragrances and for a long time I only knew about designer frags. I never knew anything about niche. But when I got back into fragrances, this was the first one I purchased to start my new collection. I went to Saks and I first sampled some Creed frags but they didnt appeal to me then and then I sampled The Bond frags. They appealed to me the most and Lafayette St was the one that grabbed me. Idk if its just me but I see colors when I smell frags especially the ones that I love. When I smelled this fragrance I seen myself out and about at the beginning of a Friday evening in the fall. The sun has not set just quite yet and the sky is dark purple and orange. There is a woman somewhere involved in this vision as well.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1279898"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1279898#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1267384" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1267384" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TyNel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1211516"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="TyNel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Mefisto-Gentiluomo-52432.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52432.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mefisto Gentiluomo"title="Mefisto Gentiluomo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1267384ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1267384" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1211516">TyNel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-12-29">12/29/20 13:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lafayette is a very pleasant and versatile scent (not quite signature worthy).  If anything, it resembles Xerjoff Uden (in a harsher and more linear way), and less similar to one or more of the Armani Code &amp; flankers.  The bergamot and vanilla are dominant from the top to the heart, with the support of coriander and amber for most of its life.  The ambroxan becomes clearer at the base.   Just like almost all other Bond No. 9, it's not worth the retail price tag, but would be a nice pickup in the price range of high end designers like Armani Code / Acqua di Gio or the Allure lines (100 ML &lt; $130 - which is about 1/3 of retail), IMO.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1267384"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1267384#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1216062" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1215052"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1215052#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1204103" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; That alone, says something about this fragrance. It clearly evokes nostalgia.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1204103"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1204103#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1204088" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1204088" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Shergo237"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1244597"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Shergo237" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Centauri-Perfumes/Mirabai-78613.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78613.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mirabai"title="Mirabai"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1204088ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1204088" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1244597">Shergo237</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-07-26">07/26/20 10:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smell is an exact replica of Nikos - Sculpture with the only difference being the dry down is stronger at the base and it lasts longer, maybe due to the ambergris..</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1204088"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1204088#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1180447" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1180447" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ambroxer"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1227733"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1227733.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ambroxer" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1180447ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1180447" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1227733">Ambroxer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-05-26">05/26/20 08:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Really enjoyed this from first sniff. Its a wonderful citrus-floral-vanilla that feels clean and uplifting. These notes all work together to create something harmonious and very special. The citrus sparkles, the flowers are delicate and the vanilla gives it a smooth, creamy base. Neither too masculine or feminine, its a scent that could truly have near universal appeal. <br />
<br />
Possibly near universal versatility too. Lafayette Street carries with it a happy, summer-y disposition which could easily compliment you for all the usual locations fragrances may be used.  Office, casual use, dates, really anything but clubbing, this would be a solid choice. The only big draw back is that the performance seems lackluster. About an hours worth of solid projection at the beginning, then it settles into a pleasant, but more subtle skin scent. Given the price, that makes Lafayette Street a bit of a nonstarter. Still, Im giving it a rave. Its a joyful scent and I cant help but smile wearing it. I may even be smitten.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1180447"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1180447#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1169864" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1169864" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Williamsmell"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201007"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Williamsmell" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Montblanc/Explorer-52002.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52002.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Explorer"title="Explorer"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1169864ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1169864" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201007">Williamsmell</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-04-30">04/30/20 12:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So...I had a chance to sample this while in Vegas at the Bond counter in Saks. Really liked it. Fast forward some months, and I ordered a decant. Again...really like it. Someone mentioned below (and they are dead on) that is smells reminiscent of Versace The Dreamer. I happen to love The Dreamer, which I'm sure is why I enjoy this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1169864"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1169864#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1143683" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1143683" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Khalid11"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1222761"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1222761.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Khalid11" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/The-Scent-of-Peace-for-Him-20551.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.20551.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Scent of Peace for Him"title="The Scent of Peace for Him"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1143683ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1143683" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88); mass appealing, the projection is loud in the first hours, longevity on my skin is above average. Signature scent worthy. I don't care about the price, just love it and will be always on my shelf.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1143683"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1143683#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1129916" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1129916" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lovescully"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/23151"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.23151.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lovescully" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Ashore-62858.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62858.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ashore"title="Ashore"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1129916ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1129916" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/23151">lovescully</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-01-01">01/01/20 16:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is another wonderful fragrance from Bond No. 9. The overall impression I get is one of creamy, sweet (but not too sweet) warm woods with a touch of citrus and apple blossom up front. Its totally unisex and feels appropriate for almost any occasion. <br />
<br />
When first sprayed on paper, I do get a very brief resemblance to Dunhill Desire and Diesel Plus Plus, but only superficially. The bergamot and (to my nose) apple blossom are the prominent top notes, but the citrus quickly disappears leaving only the floral component. Although coriander is listed as a top note, I cant detect it anywhere. Still on paper, after the first 15 minutes or so, Lafayette Street no longer resembles either the Dunhill or Diesel and has morphed into a different scent. Unlike the Dunhill that stays sweet red apple throughout its lifetime, or the Diesel that leans more towards a sweet milky vanilla, Lafayette Street is much woodier and a bit ambery. I think the creamy vibe Im getting comes from a combination of vanilla, tonka and (synthetic) ambergris.   <br />
<br />
The only difference between the experience I have on paper and that on skin is that the bergamot is non-existent. On skin I get the apple blossom first, then the warm, creamy, woody and amber base. The floral component hangs around for a while, but as the base notes really take hold, the florals all but disappear.<br />
<br />
Like the other Bond No. 9 fragrances I have experienced, Lafayette Streets performance is fantastic. It lasts all day on my masculine skin and projects quite nicely. This gets 2 thumbs up and 4 &amp; a half stars.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1129916"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1129916#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1127689" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1127689" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="style1015"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1163634"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="style1015" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1127689ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1127689" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1163634">style1015</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-12-25">12/25/19 14:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A really fabulous, masculine scent. For fragrance aficionados, it may not be the most unique scent on earth, as it has that sort of spicy-fresh manly DNA that is similar to other scents. Still, there's a reason these kinds of scents are made: they're extremely well liked and popular. You could certainly get a similar vibe with less expensive fragrances, but this one does have a richness and depth to it that I haven't experienced before. <br />
<br />
The coriander and bergamot really blend together well so it's not too citrusy and not too herbal/spicy. It just really highlights the best notes of them both.<br />
<br />
This is definitely one to test to see if you'd be willing to shell out the money for it.<br />
<br />
As a woman, I love it when I smell it on other guys. Is it the most unique scent out there? Probably not. But it smells pretty dang good.<br />
<br />
8.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1127689"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1127689#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1125495" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1125495" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="velhacega"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1143447"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1143447.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="velhacega" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Prada/Cargo-de-Nuit-32197.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.32197.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cargo de Nuit"title="Cargo de Nuit"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1125495ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1125495" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1143447">velhacega</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-12-17">12/17/19 16:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells precisely like Diesel Plus Plus for men, and that costs 15 dollars. It's jarring how much they smell alike, and for that reason I'd never recommend buying this.<br />
It's an okay scent, quite synthetic and not very faithful to the notes cited here.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1125495"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1125495#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1107177" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Not for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1107177"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1107177#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1107162" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1107162"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1107162#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1103684" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1103684" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="blakecastro1977"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1208088"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1208088.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="blakecastro1977" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dolce-Gabbana/The-One-Luminous-Night-65224.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65224.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The One Luminous Night "title="The One Luminous Night "></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1103684ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1103684" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1208088">blakecastro1977</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-10-04">10/04/19 06:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells AMAZING and I get compliments everywhere! Yes it kinda reminds me of Dunhill Desire but a very upscale version like a Mercedes vs. a Rolls Royce. Bond No.9 Success used to be my favorite but this Lafayette St. is now my new signature frag.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1103684"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1103684#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1074688" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1074688" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rafaelrodriguezabello"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1196966"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="rafaelrodriguezabello" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Egoiste-Platinum-614.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.614.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Egoiste Platinum"title="Egoiste Platinum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1074688ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1074688" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1196966">rafaelrodriguezabello</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-06-30">06/30/19 18:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is definitely a really good fragrance. Bergamot and vanilla notes do that kind of fresh warming vibe. Also similarities Whit the cheap Diesel Plus plus with better ingredients and better performance imhm.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1074688"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1074688#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1057707" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1057707" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="zaetown"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/541697"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.541697.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="zaetown" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/Grand-Soir-40816.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40816.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Grand Soir"title="Grand Soir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1057707ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1057707" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/541697">zaetown</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-05-06">05/06/19 15:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wow, this stuff performs quite well. It's reminds me of an expensive Versace dreamer, a niche version per se. The opening is fantastic and quite masculine the 1st 5 mins then takes a turn towards the feminine side but not totally. I get an aromatic vanilla and Apple accords with soft florals in the background. I can see this being worn for most occasions as it is versitale. <br />
<br />
4/5 stars</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1057707"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1057707#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1049307" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1049307" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Peto"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1144538"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Peto" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Argos/Danae-75590.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.75590.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dana"title="Dana"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1049307ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1049307" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1144538">Peto</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-04-09">04/09/19 03:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got a 5ml sample not thinking much of it because some of the reviews in here but to my surprise is really good.. Starts up really fresh and it gets a little sweet but still fresh after awhile.. Its not groundbreaking but smells really good and on top of that this thing lasts and lasts you would get noticed in a really nice way!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1049307"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1049307#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1019687" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1019687" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dimi M"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1151047"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1151047.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dimi M" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51742.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lafayette Street"title="Lafayette Street"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1019687ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1019687" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1151047">Dimi M</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-01-12">01/12/19 06:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A brief review:<br />
<br />
Smells very clean and fresh<br />
<br />
Scent starts as soapy citrus (almost like armaf tag him or bleu de channel) and transitions to vanilla with an ambroxan undertone<br />
<br />
Projection is really loud at first,but fades sharply after an hour<br />
<br />
Longevity is rather short,about 3 to 4 hours on my skin<br />
<br />
8/10 for me,6/10 if you consider the pricetag<br />
Generally good fragrance</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1019687"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1019687#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1016154" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; What a pity! guess I'll save me 350 euros, have plenty of Dunhiil Red Desire for men!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1016154"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1016154#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1012332" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1012332" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ryanmmas26"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/761961"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.761961.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ryanmmas26" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Prada/Luna-Rossa-Ocean-Le-Parfum-91693.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.91693.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Luna Rossa Ocean Le Parfum"title="Luna Rossa Ocean Le Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1012332ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1012332" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/761961">Ryanmmas26</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-12-22">12/22/18 05:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I thought this scent was ok and I enjoyed the sample I had of this but I would NOT pay Bond No 9 prices for this as there are many frags that do this smell better for a WAY more fair price. (Scents that this reminds me of are Nikos Sculpture,Thallium,Desire Red)<br />
<br />
Lafayette opens up very synthetic,fruity, and sweet.This scent is pretty linear but in the drydown it loses a lot of that fruitiness and then starts to become more of a sweet,Amber and vanilla frag in the drydown with the ambroxen giving this an extra bite. In my opinion this would have been better without the ambroxen.<br />
<br />
Performance-it lasted 4-6 hours projecting nicely for an hour and then leaving a nice scent bubble after that.<br />
<br />
Again, if I want a scent that gives off this vibe Ill go with Nikos Sculpture as I like the airiness of that scent and it projects and lasts better on my skin. (AND on top of that its way cheaper)<br />
<br />
Overall rating-6.5 out of 10 ! Scent is decent but not my favorite and there are cheaper versions of this type of scent that also perform better</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1012332"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1012332#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1010778" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
