padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1152260">xmelldefrag</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-12-17">12/17/18 10:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This scent had been done so many times before, among others: only Dunhill Desire, Jaguar Classic Gold... It's like zereangel said, this scent was popular in 90s, and to re-release it undet the new name with that hefty price is a rip off...<br />
<br />
For me most of Bond's latest release are redundant, unnecessary, and saddening.<br />
<br />
Don't blind buy this, you might smell this scent plenty of times before, with just a fraction of its price...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1010778"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1010778#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1010065" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1010065" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Zereangel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/899104"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.899104.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Zereangel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Les-Exclusifs-de-Chanel-Sycomore-4688.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4688.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Les Exclusifs de Chanel Sycomore"title="Les Exclusifs de Chanel Sycomore"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1010065ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1010065" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/899104">Zereangel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-12-15">12/15/18 04:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Really nice scent, but why is Bond cloning the 90s hit from Nikos? It smells very similar to Sculpture Homme with added strength. You can get it at a fraction of the bond price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1010065"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1010065#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1006422" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1006422" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jwhdz1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/613552"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.613552.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jwhdz1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Santal-Noir-48378.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48378.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Santal Noir"title="Santal Noir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1006422ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1006422" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/613552">Jwhdz1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-12-03">12/03/18 10:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This may trigger some so let me get this out of the way, first and foremost.  I'm a fan of Bond no. 9 as a house so I was excited to get my nose on this release since I was hearing such good things.  I tested this and to my nose (and the nose of pretty much everyone around me) this is 99% identical to Dunhill Desire, which can be had for a fraction of the cost.  I wore this to work one day and wore Dunhill Desire the next and literally, no one could tell that they were not the same fragrance.  Before dropping more than $200.00 on this fragrance, sample and compare next to Dunhill first.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1006422"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1006422#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent999463" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc999463" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="picknenders"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/846250"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.846250.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="picknenders" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Puredistance/M-V2Q-74481.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.74481.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="M V2Q"title="M V2Q"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma999463ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd999463" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/846250">picknenders</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-11-09">11/09/18 16:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Admittedly, I havent experienced that much of bonds offerings - mostly just the ones you hear talked about the most. While Ive had a few in my collection over the years, none have stuck. <br />
<br />
Lafayette May be the one that bucks the trend. <br />
<br />
Lafayette Street starts with a familair, powerful sweetened citrus opening. Heavy vanilla and citrus. Not biting or airy - it has weight to it. Feels heavy. <br />
<br />
It resembles something - and the closest thing that I can compare it to would be Escada Magnetism. The heavy sweetness is similarly present in Lafayette. By no means is it a clone - but it has the same vibe. <br />
<br />
The ambroxan in Lafayette gives it some serious weight - and potentially adds the twist that makes it unique. <br />
<br />
Lafayette is for the masses - along the lines of scent of peace. This will be liked by the majority and disliked by few. <br />
<br />
The considerable hype around Lafayette has built for the inevitable let down -  and yeah, I cant say its worthy of the massive aventus killer hype. We want something new so badly - something to knock the last gen frags back into the past. I dont think this is it. I think this is definitely a top notch scent - and I think it will stay in my collection. But is this new? No, not really. Its a great release - and worthy of praise - but if youre thinking its going to be a world beater, be ready for the inevitable let down. <br />
<br />
Great, mass appealing release from Bond.<br />
<br />
7/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="999463"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=999463#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent996340" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc996340" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Aces8081"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1170452"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1170452.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Aces8081" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/Musc-Ravageur-1801.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1801.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Musc Ravageur"title="Musc Ravageur"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma996340ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd996340" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1170452">Aces8081</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-10-31">10/31/18 09:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Amazing!!! I think this will become one of Bonds best sellers, if not the best.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="996340"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=996340#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent995156" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc995156" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="acanania.1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1047920"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="acanania.1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma995156ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd995156" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1047920">acanania.1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-10-27">10/27/18 04:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lafayette street is amazing! It's a beautiful oriental gourmand. The tonka bean, vanilla, and amber mix together to create a smooth creamy base that is intoxicating. but for a tonka-based fragrance it's not dark. The top notes are very bright and sweet, and the combination smells almost edible. It grabs your attention right away and you can't help but fall in love with it. The projection and performance are fantastic as well. You will have a nice scent bubble for a day at work or a night on the town. It's also a very versatile fragrance. I feel like you could wear this to almost any occasion and at any time throughout the year. In my opinion,  this is one of, if not, the best Bond no. 9. Lafayette street is signature scent worthy!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="995156"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=995156#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent992862" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc992862" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Zobert"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1169183"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Zobert" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51742.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lafayette Street"title="Lafayette Street"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma992862ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd992862" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1169183">Zobert</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-10-19">10/19/18 13:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am not a perfume connoisseur and I rarely write reviews. However, this perfume has won my heart and soul, as well as my nose, so I thought I better let the world know it. I usually have a hard time tolerating fragrance if I spray it on my arms or neck. I usually have to spray it on my stomach so that I get the occasional whiff without being overwhelmed by it; otherwise, I get headaches and feel a little queasy. Lafayette Street is different. I don't know what it is about this perfume, but it smells so amazing that I just want to spray it on my upper lip so my nostrils can delight in it all day long. I haven't gone to that extreme yet, but I do spray it on my arm and I stick my nose in my elbow and breathe deeply throughout the day. :) I highly recommend this perfume!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="992862"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=992862#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent991945" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc991945" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="FairyDust"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1557"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1557.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="FairyDust" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/The-Different-Company/Majaina-Sin-46800.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46800.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Majana Sin"title="Majana Sin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma991945ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd991945" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1557">FairyDust</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-10-16">10/16/18 14:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Over the weekend, my daughter called me with pure excitement to tell me how she had just discovered this amazing perfume at the Saks counter. She said she was in love with BOND NO.9 LAFAYETTE STREET and that she couldn't wait for me to smell it. I was VERY intrigued because this daughter of mine is EXTREMELY picky when it comes to perfume! She hates a LOT, likes some, but loves only a few! Her all-time favorite is BOND NO.9 DUBAI AMETHYST, but that one is now tied with LAFAYETTE STREET for the Number 1 spot on her very brief GREATEST HITS list. I was even more surprised to learn, however, that my son-in-law, also an avid perfume critic, loved LAFAYETTE STREET as much as my daughter and encouraged her to buy it! <br />
<br />
Since I have been a perfume-obsessed creature my entire life, probably since birth, I couldn't wait to extend my pleasure of inhaling a newfound masterpiece that might possibly be worthy of becoming a future addition to my own extensive, comprehensive and evergrowing PERFUME HOARD. (That's how my daughter refers to it, anyway.) :p  Fortunately, I had the chance to visit my daughter and son-in-law the very next day and, although I had some doubts, bc of aforementioned perfume hoard, I was also blown away by the first sniff of LAFAYETTE STREET. It truly is AH-MAZING! A pure work of art and that's hard to pull off in the perfume world. This one is complex, bewitching even. Not easily described. <br />
<br />
LAFAYETTE STREET immediately drew me in with its fizzy-fresh, bright beginning.  Breezy, citrus, top notes sparkle and dazzle all the way at the top, but without a trace of harsh/screechy, synthetic, citrus-grove notes which I cannot stomach. I was then mesmerized and drawn into an incredible, billowy, creamy cloud of slightly sweet, woodsy notes, dancing with hints of pomme (apple), vanilla and ambroxan, that are absolutely hypnotic! The apple note is really indescribable; it's so well done, and elusive, that you won't even recognize it at first. This creamy, woodsy heart with just a touch of sweetness is my favorite part. Pure perfection and so delectable! Thankfully, the sweetness never nears the line that borders Candy/Cupcake Land where much of the perfume market resides today. Just sweet enough to be completely irresistible, leaving you wanting more.  The Ambroxan effects quite a magical impact here, lending LAFAYETTE STREET a lovely warmth and smoothness while also amplifying its intoxicating musky-amberiness.<br />
<br />
I can't get enough of LAFAYETTE STREET and longevity is fantastic! I've been wearing it for 10 hours now and it hasn't faded into oblivion or morphed into something boring, or horrible, as many perfumes do today. The transition from opening to drydown has been superb and is still going strong! LAFAYETTE STREET is so completely satisfying and comforting, yet at the same time, it quickens to some kind of kinetic energy that's wondrously uplifting! I don't understand what kind of voodoo is going on inside that gorgeous, textured bottle, but there is some masterful combination of just enough light and darkness to make this completely unisex. This is a winner and has gone to my top shelf here which I haven't changed in years!  <br />
<br />
Kudos to Laurice Rahme, the gifted parfumeur at Bond No. 9, for creating such a well-blended, beautiful perfume!  I have been, and continue to be, very impressed with the offerings and quality from this house. And thanks to my wonderful, beautiful daughter and her thoughtful husband for sharing their amazing find with me and who are never afraid to explore new scents or allow fragrance advisors to offer their professorial perfume knowledge. Lucky me!  I'm definitely addicted and will need my own bottle soon! Like mother like daughter! Or in this case, maybe it's like daughter like mother? :P I don't know, but I am in love with and need LAFAYETTE STREET!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="991945"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=991945#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                    </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">

padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc991945" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="FairyDust"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1557"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1557.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="FairyDust" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/The-Different-Company/Majaina-Sin-46800.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46800.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Majana Sin"title="Majana Sin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma991945ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd991945" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1557">FairyDust</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-10-16">10/16/18 14:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Over the weekend, my daughter called me with pure excitement to tell me how she had just discovered this amazing perfume at the Saks counter. padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1708673" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dahk2323"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1476753"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1476753.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dahk2323" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Vanilla-Barka-71111.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.71111.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanilla Barka"title="Vanilla Barka"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1708673ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1708673" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1476753">Dahk2323</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-13">12/13/22 17:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This stuff is ridiculous. Just buy it. To the naysayersyou crazy. Amazing scent overall, amazing transformation, and performance is what would be expected of a $500 bottle of parfum. Nothing like it and therefore, nothing to compare to. It stands alone and very proudly at that!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1708673"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1708673#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1284046" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1284046" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="e2less"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1290667"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1290667.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="e2less" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nishane/Nanshe-64093.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64093.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Nanshe"title="Nanshe"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1284046ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1284046" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1290667">e2less</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-29">01/29/21 21:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bond No 9 Lafayette Street is a winner for me. It starts off with a blast of fresh/clean citrus amber with a sweet vanilla ... kinda zingy or fizzy. Image opening a Sprite (vanilla) soda. The mid tones becomes candy like with a light musky woody dry down. The projection is very loud at first so control your sprays. Lets just say I'll spray 3x next time (cough cough).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1284046"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1284046#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2108233" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2108233" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gharper"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1787902"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1787902.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gharper" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Armaf/Club-de-Nuit-Intense-Man-Limited-Edition-Parfum-77861.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.77861.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Club de Nuit Intense Man Limited Edition Parfum"title="Club de Nuit Intense Man Limited Edition Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2108233ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2108233" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1787902">gharper</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-29">03/29/24 15:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Anyone who says this smells cheap is either lying, or expecting too much out of a fragrance. Perhaps the retail is too steep, but on a discounted this is one hell of a purchase. For me the scent is fairly linear, maybe with the dry down being slightly sweeter. Performance is good, definitely masculine because of the woodiness, ambroxan, and spice combo. As for the scent itself, its amazing. But for gatekeeping purposes, this sucks dont buy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2108233"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2108233#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent992862" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc992862" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Zobert"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1169183"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Zobert" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51742.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lafayette Street"title="Lafayette Street"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma992862ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd992862" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1169183">Zobert</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-10-19">10/19/18 13:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am not a perfume connoisseur and I rarely write reviews. However, this perfume has won my heart and soul, as well as my nose, so I thought I better let the world know it. I usually have a hard time tolerating fragrance if I spray it on my arms or neck. I usually have to spray it on my stomach so that I get the occasional whiff without being overwhelmed by it; otherwise, I get headaches and feel a little queasy. Lafayette Street is different. I don't know what it is about this perfume, but it smells so amazing that I just want to spray it on my upper lip so my nostrils can delight in it all day long. I haven't gone to that extreme yet, but I do spray it on my arm and I stick my nose in my elbow and breathe deeply throughout the day. :) I highly recommend this perfume!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="992862"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=992862#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="51742" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">

padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1897768" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JusttheFactsMan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1733487"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1733487.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JusttheFactsMan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bois-1920/Itruk-32129.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.32129.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Itruk"title="Itruk"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1897768ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1897768" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1733487">JusttheFactsMan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-09">08/09/23 07:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>#203 in my "Tour de Fragrance"<br />
<br />
I won't waste lot of time on this one. It's Dunhill Desire Red in a cool bottle at 10X the price. Total sucker play. This is my second Bond No 9 fragrance and I'm seeing a pattern form here where they put out something with a fizzy opening, which I admit is unique, then it dries down to a scent you've smelled before out of a bottle of something in the under $30 range, in this case a Dunhill scent that I gave away even though it wasn't a bad buy at $23 a bottle on Gift Express. But $300+??? Heard the saying, "I was born at night, but not last night?"</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1897768"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1897768#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1107177" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1107177" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="black_orchid"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/81370"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.81370.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="black_orchid" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/Une-Fleur-de-Cassie-4773.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4773.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Une Fleur de Cassie"title="Une Fleur de Cassie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1107177ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1107177" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/81370">black_orchid</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-10-16">10/16/19 23:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like nearly Nikos Scalpture. Not for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="1107177"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=1107177#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2252429" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2252429" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ismellthebest"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1305612"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1305612.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ismellthebest" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/XJ-1861-Naxos-30529.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30529.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="XJ 1861 Naxos"title="XJ 1861 Naxos"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2252429ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2252429" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1305612">Ismellthebest</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-17">08/17/24 12:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Buy Lafayette? Well Not Yet<br />
<br />
To me, Bond's Lafayette Street offers a sweet fresh &amp; fruity undertone as it opens up.  Good projection and it lasts. It's definitely a warm weather scent to wear.  <br />
<br />
Thats the good news. Here is the bad news - I paid retail for my bottle and found out later I could have saved a couple hundred dollars had a gone a different route.<br />
<br />
Jo Milano's Wild Card smells identical to Lafayette Street and its much, much cheaper. So, if you want the better BING- POW- BANG!!!! for your buck... I suggest that you not walk down Lafayette Street.... maybe walk down the Milano Street.  <br />
<br />
I wish I had known this before I purchased my initial bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2252429"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2252429#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2001861" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2001861" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Thatbwoy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1371788"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1371788.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Thatbwoy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Moschino/Toy-Boy-55858.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55858.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Toy Boy"title="Toy Boy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2001861ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2001861" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1371788">Thatbwoy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-15">12/15/23 06:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Erm<br />
<br />
I wanted to sample this asand Im kinda embarrassed to sayI had seen a lot of rappers, actors and athletes talk about it.<br />
<br />
Normally, ordinarily and as a quantifier thats a RED FLAG for me, especially if (no offence) theyre American or English Footballers.<br />
<br />
But there was every chance that I would like it.<br />
<br />
I dont hate it, but I also dont like it. I have just a very clear understanding that my assumptions on the clutch of people are not to be trusted. Actually maybe their stylists shouldnt be trusted.<br />
<br />
This is not a particularly exceptional fragrance; its ok. I know I wouldnt buy this for the RRP I dont think a decent discount would tempt me. The price itself is not the thing that puts me off. Im just not moved or stirred towards buying a fragrance like this.<br />
<br />
This is a very nice scent but also very generic. Its like a really good body spray. Like if Lynx/Axe created a pricier version of their own products. The quality is good but the problem I have with it is it just sticks around- I know thats an odd thing to say, but it just doesnt do anything its very annoyingly linear and unremarkable for what it its presenting itself to be.<br />
<br />
Its clean fresh and not as interesting as the hype around it demands. If you want to pay for the fact that you can drop it into conversation that you own it - fair enough. If on the other hand you just want to smell very nice then you are spoilt for choice out there as theres loads that smell like this.<br />
<br />
6.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2001861"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2001861#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2206481" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2206481" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="_ry508"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2112610"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2112610.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="_ry508" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Qaed-Al-Fursan-67996.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67996.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Qaed Al Fursan"title="Qaed Al Fursan"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2206481ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2206481" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2112610">_ry508</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-02">07/02/24 20:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bought a tester and for me at least it smells very soapy, almost like dryer sheets. I don't get how everyone is saying it smells good. Sprayed some on my body, asked people about it and they said I smell fresh but soapy. Extremely disappointing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51742"comment_id="2206481"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Lafayette-Street-51742.html?ccid=2206481#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="51742" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="search-reviews"><search-perfume-reviews :perfume_id="51742":random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]"></search-perfume-reviews></div></div><foundation-tabs></foundation-tabs></reviews-wrapper></div><perfume-shortcut-menu :perfume_id="51742" when-hidden="#toptop"></perfume-shortcut-menu><initialize-status-data></initialize-status-data><div class="cell small-12"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_footer -->

    </div>

<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFr7c4b6b084f801d1036ebe90095780be1');
        });
    }
</script>
